prerequisite: Must be registered as a Graduate student in the university or with the approval of the Department.
moduleDescription: The objectives of this course are to invite students to reflect on and analyse texts by great women novelists. Topics covered include the choice of genre, the relation between narrative structure and psychological experience and their political implications, the nature of the dilemmas at the heart of each text, and the problems of defining and responding to what is specific to women’s writing. For MA-level students with an interest in women’s writing.
